TER.TERdecoder.SegmentDecoder
Class InitialDecoding

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERdecoder.SegmentDecoder.InitialDecoding

public class InitialDecoding
extends java.lang.Object

This class decode the quantized DC components or the bitDepthAC_Block. Usage example:

lastBlockDecoded

int lastBlockDecoded
This integer indicates the last value entropy decoded before the file ends

completionMode

int completionMode
This integer indicates the way that values are completed when an abnormal termination is found. That means that the file ends and not all the values have been decoded. Valid values are:
  • 0 - Put O to the uncoded values
  • 1 - Repeat the middle value of the magnitude interval where the components are being decoded, i.e., (max(-xMin,xMax)+1)/2.
  • 2 - Repeat the mean value of the recovered values
  • n - For n>2, repeat the mean value of the n-2 last recovered values. If less than n-2 values have been recovered, only the recovered values will be used. Note that for n=3 we repeat the last value.

abnormalTermination

boolean abnormalTermination
This boolean indicates if the decoding process finishes correctly

run

public int[] run(ReadBufferedStream codedSegment)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Run the initial decoding of either DC components or bitDepthAC_Block

Parameters:
codedSegment - bit stream which contains the information required for the decoding process.
Returns:
an integer array containing recovered values.
Throws:
ErrorException - when something goes wrong, for example parameters are not set, and compression must be stopped.
java.lang.Exception

public int[] entropyDecode(ReadBufferedStream codedSegment,
                           int N)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
This function entropy decodes according to the paramateres given.

Parameters:
codedSegment - bit stream containing information required for decoding process.
N - number of bits needed to represent the values.
Returns:
an array of integers which contain the decoded values.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when the bitstream cannot be loaded.

undoMapAndDPCM

public int[] undoMapAndDPCM(int[] delta,
                            int xMin,
                            int xMax,
                            int N)
This function performs unmaps obtained values and undo DPCM.

Parameters:
delta - array of integer values that must be unmapped and undo DPCM.
xMin - reprensents the minimum value that could be taken by the decoded values.
xMax - reprensents the maximum value that could be taken by the decoded values.
N - number of bits needed to represent the values.
Returns:
an integer array containing the unmapped values and DPCM inversed
